sub_title: Owner and Principal Reliability Management Consultant at Peter Bitter Reliability Management Consultancy and Coaching
summary:
As a technical professional with 30+ years of experience in the Oil, Gas and Chemical industry, both International as well as National in the areas of Reliability, Maintenance, Operations excellence, Production excellence, Flawless Project delivery, Change Management, Organizational effectiveness, Leadership and Problem Solving I am now available for my next challenge.
Due to my Technical (MSc Mech.Eng) as well as my Business (MBA) background I combine an organisational insight and human interest with a technical analytical mindset thus simplifying complex issues in structured and coherent explanations.
My passion is analysing Organisations, Management processes or Technical processes or incidents, determine the Gaps and coach, drive and facilitate people in the implementation of jointly developed fit for purpose improvements and solutions. By lecturing courses and coaching individuals I enjoy transferring my own and the company's knowledge.

contact: peter@peterbitter.nl

profile_positions.company: Peter Bitter Reliability Management Consultancy and Coaching
profile_positions.description:
As an independent Reliability Management Consultant I can support You and your organisation by Analysis, Advise, Structuring, Support, Facilitation, Training and Coaching of:
•	Reliability Organisation effectiveness by Review and Gap analysis 
•	Availability and Reliability Analysis (from Firefighting mode to Proactive control)
•	Work process Analysis and Improvement: 
•	Problem Solving and incident investigation (RCA and Causal Reasoning); 
•	Prioritisation management;
•	Maintenance Management and organisation;
•	TA Management and organisation;

I am strongly convinced that Reliability, Maintenance and Operations must be working together as a team to improve Reliability, Availability and thus Margin improvement and Cashflow. My approach to improvement is therefore organising collaboration and buy-in from all relevant Stakeholders.

Since mid-2018 I have supported globally various international companies in TA Management reviews, Problem Investigation training and facilitation, Reliability Management support and Maintenance management Consultancy.

My Main drivers are:
•	Margin sustainability and Cashflow improvement
•	Reduce frustration and overload of staff in the organisation
•	Bring Clarity and Structure in the agreed way of working
•	Approach in an integrated way (cooperation between Operations, Maintenance,  Reliability and others)
•	Focus on Short Term improvements and Long Term Sustainability

Areas of work are Oil&Gas; Chemical and other Technical Industries

profile_positions.title: Principal Engineer Operation Excellence

profile_positions.description:
As Consultant and Principal Engineer I led several Reliability improvement opportunities and also acted as the Reliability team-member in several Bussines Process improvement consultancy programmes and Workshops at Shell Businesses, JV's and 3rd Parties. Work involved Integrated assessment and analysis of the 'As-Is' situation and jointly develop and implement a 'To-Be' situation of the Consulting and the home team where I acted as the theme-lead in the areas of Turn-Around Management, Problem Solving and Reliability Management. Apart from Business/Facilities Health Checks and Reviews at 3rd Parties (worldwide) I developed into a Subject Matter Expert in Problem Solving and Investigation Facilitation. I developed, delivered and implemented on site Problem solving processes & trained local (Shell, JV, 3P) facilitators in RCA. Also I facilitated many investigations of which one was a high impact incident RCA with international focus. Apart from my passion for Structured Problem Analysis and Solution development I also delight in coaching and training.
During these years I facilitated and improved the Threat finding Workshops and developed and implemented a new methodology to review existing assets for (High Impact and Low Probability) Vulnerabilities and facilitated many Vulnerability Reviews worldwide.

profile_positions.description: As Head of Production at the Hague site (2003- Sept 2005) producing potable water from dune water I was responsible and accountable for production (approx. 2/3 of total DZH production) of potable water and all maintenance at this production site, including being ‘landlord’ of the site. I introduced and implemented many improved processes at my Production site (PTW - introduced at all production locations; MOC procedure; Procedure 'Working in confined spaces'; Site Rules and Regulations for Contractors; LCC in design and instigated proper start-up and controlled hand over Projects to Asset) and managed the change in mindset of my staff to work in a disciplined and structured way. As Maintenance Manager of all Production installations (Sept 2005- March 2006) I improved Process workflow of Job orders, enforced cost control, introduced Project approach in larger Maintenance jobs.
